title: Trump Administration Appeals to Supreme Court to Block Order to Pay Full SNAP Benefits
summary: The temporary ruling by Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson, blocking a lower court order to fully fund the aid, added to the uncertainty around the nation’s largest anti-hunger program.

title: Judge Blocks National Guard From Portland and Says Trump Overstepped His Authority
summary: With her temporary block expiring, Judge Karin Immergut said the Trump administration had failed to prove that protesters were hampering President Trump’s policies.

title: A Light in Very Dark Days: Nancy Pelosi and AIDS
summary: As Ms. Pelosi announced her retirement, she was celebrated for her long tenure in Washington. But back home, she was remembered for showing up at a terrifying moment when others turned away.

title: Among Mamdani’s Many Upcoming Challenges: Fixing New York City’s Schools
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect, will encounter dwindling enrollment, lackluster reading scores and federal officials spoiling for a fight.

title: ‘You Are All Terrorists’: Four Months in a Salvadoran Prison
summary: The Times interviewed dozens of migrant men sent to a prison in El Salvador by the Trump administration. Independent forensic analysts called the testimony credible and consistent and said the treatment met the U.N.’s definition of torture.

title: What I Learned From the ‘New Globalists’ of an Optimistic Nation
summary: Few countries are excited about globalization anymore, but Vietnam is still into it — wholeheartedly. Do the reasons go beyond economic growth?

title: Trump Aid Cuts Kill More Christians Than Jihadists Do
summary: Murderous attacks on Christians and Muslims alike are a real problem in Nigeria. Cutting humanitarian assistance there is even more lethal.

title: Are Post-Trump Politics Emerging?
summary: The round table convenes to discuss what comes after the Democrats’ big wins — and whether the “red hat” coalition can recover.

title: Sound System
summary: It can be challenging to discover new music on streaming platforms. Today, some ideas to help you out of a listening rut.

title: Saudi Ex-Intelligence Official Seeks American Help Spilling U.S. Secrets
summary: Saad Aljabri, feuding with the de facto Saudi ruler, wants former U.S. officials to help him fend off Saudi corruption claims.

title: Biden Warns of a ‘Very, Very Dark Moment’ as He Hits Out at Trump
summary: The former president, now a far less popular figure in his party, appeared in Nebraska for an overtly political speech that slammed his successor.

title: UPS and FedEx Ground MD-11 Cargo Planes After Louisville Crash
summary: Boeing, the plane’s manufacturer, said it had recommended the grounding as a precaution while it conducts further analysis.

title: The DNA Helix Changed How We Thought About Ourselves
summary: “The laws of inheritance are quite unknown,” Charles Darwin acknowledged in 1859. The discovery of DNA’s shape altered how we conceived of life itself.
